Reviews.Title: “dont go in room nr 503 ...!”
Reviews.Author: sterodos
Reviews.Content: a very good hotel,but the shower in the room is very dangerous in room nr 503 ... if you take it you will see.. also the breakfast was ok and especially the beds are very nice ... yes it is near the hill and also near very cheap shops..

Reviews.Title: “Please, don't call it a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Reikov
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a few minutes walk from major attractions of Istanbul, but it is at the end of an uphill walk, very uncomfortable especially by car. To be honest, the overall design is quite poor, rooms are very small, and the level of cleanliness is low. The elevator is a coffin, dark and without air and Internet access (with fee) is dark and narrow. The top floor with lovely views of the Bosphorus hosts the restaurant with an acceptable international menu. The staff is friendly and is easy to communicate in English but please don't call it a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: torkhani
Reviews.Content: We - a family of 5 members stayed 14 nights at this hotel, which is very central located. The hotel is OK and the staff gave us a good service. The room was OK but was not the biggest. But who comes to a new place and stays at the hotel? ;-) At the hotelÂ´s homepage they show their swimming pool but they forget to tell the visitors that they should pay for the use of it.... It is the first time I have tried this. My kids went a few times to swim there but they told me that the water was very cold. I will not recommend this hotel for visitors who do not walk that good because the way up to the mainroad is quite hard.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly ok place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GloJul
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Assos Hotel for 2 nights with my parents when we were both visiting Turkey. I found this place perfectly fine although I agree with the other reviews that it maybe isn't a 4 star hotel. However, the room was nice and clean and we all had enough space. It was a little noisy (people talking and shouting on the street and a really loud car wash) but it didn't bother me (but I do tend to sleep through most things). I found the breakfast to be really good with lots of choice. I will also say that the staff weren't the friendliest that I have met in my life, but they answered questions when needed and were courteous. Good location and yes, it is on a hill, but you can't really avoid hills in Istanbul wherever you stay. If you are able to walk and are in reasonable shape, you should be able to walk up a hill.

Reviews.Title: “The truth about assos hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Ochakdai
Reviews.Content: Service: staff seem unprofessional!! Little things that make a difference were missing. Eg: ask them to get u a taxi for the airport, they'll charge u 75lira! Do it urself, it costs u 30lira! Breakfast: terrible, terrible, terrible!! It's a joke! No fruit, bad yogurt, not even omellete!! Bread is old!! I was shocked!! For any1 considering this!! Pls Dnt!! U'll waste money for bad service and only eaT olives for breakfast!!!

Reviews.Title: “No frills - good location for the cost”
Reviews.Author: Clint494
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was a good hotel, though I agree not a 4-star. You get what you pay for, so for a low price it was a good deal. There is a spa/hamam in the lower floors, but there was nobody there when we tried to go in. Here are the pros and cons: PROS - Great location - five minute walk to the Grand Bazaar, 15 to Blue Mosque. Yes it's several blocks down the hill, but no big deal for us. - Decent restaurant with buffet breakfast (included) and dinner (extra charge, but reasonable prices). - Nice staff. Most spoke little English, but the front desk folks spoke it well. CONS - There's a mosque right across the street, so bring earplugs if you don't want to wake up to the 4am call to prayer. - The A/C didn't work. No big deal for us since it was cool most of the time, but it might get miserable in the summer. - Very small rooms. We booked a room for two adults and a child and they literally had to wedge the extra cot in between our bed and the wall. - Thin walls. Not only could we hear the people in the next room, but there was a wedding reception in the the restaurant one night, and the music could be heard in our room (we were one floor below). - Wireless Internet in the rooms is spotty. In our room, the signal was weak if you stood by the door, non existent as you backed you went into the room. We had to go into the hall. This is definitely not a 4-star hotel, but if you're looking for a low-cost, low-frills hotel (place to sleep, not to hang out), this is it. Assos offers an airport shuttle for 30 Euro - don't bother. From the airport to the hotel is only 30-35 Lira (about 15 Euro) and no chance of being left/forgotten as the other reviewer mentioned. The airport has a line of cabs waiting, and they should all be metered (less chance of getting ripped off). Additionally, you can take the tram system to the hotel for two 1.70 Lira tokens (you make one stop to change trains). The train stop is right at the top of the hill from the hotel. It does take a little longer and if you're not familiar with the area it might be difficult. Returning on the tram is easy if you're comfortable riding metro/tube systems (we did it with our son no problem). It is a bit longer in the tram (about an hour compared to 20-30 minutes in a cab). Or just take a taxi back.

Reviews.Title: “Central,value for money, friendly”
Reviews.Author: ArnieSalfordU_K_
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Assos from 12th March to the 19th March, A very claen and friendly hotel, super buffet style breakfast, very central, The Grand Bazzar only 5 minutes away and the Blue Mosque a 15 minute stroll along the main road. About half way down a steep hill , but Istanbul is quite hilly even you walked down the hill you would have to climb one sooner or later to get to the Mosque. We ate most nights in the Hotel but there are a lot of restaurants close by but you can only eat so much fish.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Europhila
Reviews.Content: Arrived late at night and were shown to our room which appeared to overlook the town, judging by the lights below; come the morning we realised that the lights were on the fishing boats and we overlooked the sea, wow! The Hotel is situated in a slightly shabby area and the 10 minute walk to the main street for trams etc is steep and quite hazardous with some steps, in poor repair, and watch out for open holes leading to shops in cellars! I wouldn't advise walking down there in the dark, if only for that reason. The hotel is very clean and our room was completely new, we were the first occupants. The bathroom had an all singing, all dancing shower cubicle, spa and massage features etc. Our only criticism, it was a bit small, perhaps should have been a single rather than a double and whilst being next to the dining room has some advantages, the noise from it is not one of them. Breakfast is reasonable and the restaurant serves good, inexpensive food if you don't want to venture out at night. The sound of the Muezzin calling the faithful to prayer on the first morning was a bit eerie but you do get used to it and Istanbul is amazing. Go there!!

Reviews.Title: “they did hounor there booking”
Reviews.Author: albTA
Reviews.Content: I've picked up the assos hotel name from the internet, and on 1/9/2010, I requested from them to book a room 16-17/9/2010, and gave them my arrival flight's details. They confirmed the booking on 6/9/2010 no. 4069 at Euro 55.- BB/single. On 16/9, when I showed up, they simply said: Sorry, the hotel is fully booked!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sima_Atri
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was great - walking distance to the tramway, Grand Bazaar and Sultanahmet (Blue Mosque / Aya Sofia). The hill is not a big deal. Breakfast was good and plentiful. Rooms are good and air conditioning worked well but was turned off during the day. The staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel i have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: classyza
Reviews.Content: Okay so i choose the hotel thinking its 4* as advertised in expedia!! let me tel you one thing, IT IS NOT 4* its between 2/3. Where do i start: the staff are all arrogant and unfriendly. One lady at the front reception gave us dirty looks everyday and anytime we passed reception. The staff generally dont care about you. The room air conditioning does not work, we changed rooms 3 times and all times it was hot.. Its not air conditioning, its merely A CHEAP fan and it will never cool a big room!! the lobby has NO AIRCONDITIONING, they dont switch it on, claiming its broken!! i sweated more in the lobby, the outside in 34 degrees temperature!! the hotel is at the bottom of a hill and getting to the main road is hard as its soo steep. the breakfast is very very average!! The lifts in the hotel are a million years old, have space for only 2 people and is totally like a grave!! u cant breathe.. we often choose to use the starts to get to our room on level 4!! overall its a pathatic excuse for a hotel!!! only plus was that there was free wifi in the lobby downstairs!!!

Reviews.Title: “3 stars hotel advertised as 4 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: almufti
Reviews.Content: I reserved in this hotel through otel.com where it was stated that it is a 4 stars hotel. I realized at check-in it is a 3 stars hotel. I checked in other booking sites to see it was advertised as 3 stars not 4. Room air conditioning is running fan only. After checking with the reception to operate cooling they informed me they cannot do anything in this respect as this is the policy of the owner. No bathroom amenities but only cheap quality soap and gel in dispensers.A bathtube is available but you cant fill it as the plug is missing. It is nice to go Green and save energy and water but to change the the rating os such hotel to 2 stars not to falsely upgrade it.

Reviews.Title: “Solo Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LoraN2
Reviews.Content: The service was great and very personal. They made me feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Only the lobby is airconditioned”
Reviews.Author: NGMD
Reviews.Content: The temperature was in the mid 30's (90's F). The web site assured me it was air conditioned.But when I complained about my stifling room, I was told that winter began on September 1 and I didn't need air conditioning. After a shift change in the staff, someone came up and solemnly turned the switch on and off, and assured me the room would be cool soon. He refused to put his hand on the vent and confirm that there was no air coming out of it. After a miserable night being eaten by mosquitoes and sweating, I was moved to another room--which also had no air conditioning, although I was assured that it did. I spent a week in Istanbul and never got a real night's sleep. Horrid, horrid hotel. And incidentally, just out of curiosity I tried the heat--it doesn't work either.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need! But on a very steep hill”
Reviews.Author: Shugz_16
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is PERFECT! but its on a very steep hill, which is hard to climb up for older travellers. We got there at about half past one and they let us check in early which was great! Rooms were clean and tidy although the bathroom was a little small, and you had to climb in so not great for older travellers. The room had everything you need, clean sheets and towels which is all you need really. Your given shampoo and shower gel although i recommend you take your own. Hotel staff were very helpful and friendly and everything we asked for we were given, i.e we asked for an iron and we were given it for the 5days which was great as we got to use it at our own leisure. We were out most days and came in and out all day which was fine. the room was cleaned everyday. On the beds are just single sheets as duvets and a cow patterned blanket (which is a little itchy). Breakfast was not amazing but wasnt horrible either, boiled eggs, bread rolls jams honey etc. with salami and chicken was fine nothing made us ill although was the same everyday. Although the view from the 6th floor restaurant was stunning! you can see the coast and the sea of marmara. It has a swimming pool, sauna and turkish bath. I had a massage which cost me â‚¬20 which was a bargin for a full body massage! I would recommend going to the male and not the female as i went to the male and had an amazing massage he was gentle and friendly but spoke limited english. However my sister went to the female and found it very painful at the time and for a few days after. Overall its a great hotel, wouldnt recommend any of the tours though as they charge you an arm and a leg. The tram is at the top of the hill and takes you everywhere you need to go and singles are about 75p (1.5 turkish lira). We found it at least 70% cheaper doing everything ourself. Hope this review helped. If you want anymore information or help for your trip feel free to e-mail me for advance on where to go and how to get there etc. on bestpaki786@hotmail.com. Have a nice trip!

Reviews.Title: “It is ok”
Reviews.Author: Snarf2
Reviews.Content: I am often in Ist, Assos hotel is okay! Dont forget to go to the haman in the hotel. The masseur gives perfect massage. Hotel staff is friendly .

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly staff, good restaurant with great view, excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: JustinianWyoming
Reviews.Content: The staff of the Assos couldn't have been more friendly or helpful during our 5 day stay. They made us feel quite at home. The hotel's public spaces are very well appointed, and the 6th floor restaurant has a great view of the Sea of Marmara. There was an extensive choice of food at the breakfast buffet, & dinner there was good as well. Our room was on the small side & one sheet of wallpaper was starting to curl, but it was clean & the TV worked fine. The Assos's only disadvantage for us was its location just across the street from a mosque whose call to prayer practically shook us out of bed every morning at 4:30. My wife could get back to sleep afterward but I couldn't.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE - IT RUINED OUR OTHERWISE ENJOYABLE TIME IN ISTANBUL”
Reviews.Author: sddavid
Reviews.Content: 1. The only good thing about the hotel is the location, it's near many of the major tourist sites but you'd have to be fairly fit to stay here as it's located half way down a hill. The location isn't the cleanest, many of the roads nearby are very dirty! The view from our hotel room was of dirty streets. 2. The rooms are okay, the main thing is that they were clean but the views weren't great. The rooms were of average size. They were fairly basic and of no way a 4 star hotel as stated in many websites. There were no tea/coffee facilities. No iron or ironing board. No tolietries. There was a minibar placed in the room 3 days into our stay though it was empty so you can say we had an empty fridge not a mini bar! We then bought our own drinks and subsequently placed the drinks in the fridge and was accused of not paying for the drinks when we were checking out a week later. We explained to the staff at reception "THAT THE DRINKS WERE OUR OWN DRINKS, THAT NO DRINKS WERE PLACED IN THE FRIDGE IN THE 1ST PLACE" it was horrible, the staff didn't believe us and all we could was explain over & over again that they were our drinks. We had to get the bell boy to confirm our story as he had witness the mini bar placed in our room without it being filled. Only when he confirm the story did the manager believe us. It was shocking behaviour to say the least! We didn't even get an apology! 3. Only 2 of all the staff spoke broken english, all the other staff didn't understand a word, so whenever we asked about something, we were always kept waiting around as the staff had to find someone who spoke english. 4. The breakfast was basic, the same thing everyday! eggs (either boiled, or scrambled- it alternated day to day) bread, yoghurt, canned fruit, sliced salami, sliced cheese & fried potato, juice & tea/coffee 5. The hotel can arrange different types of tours, we went on a mini cruise up the Brophorus river for 35Euros. We were told it was to last 4 hours (8am-12pm) but the coach picked us up late at 8.30, the driver then had to pick up other tourists at other hotels which continued until 9.15. We headed to the spice market where we had 30mins or so to shop before heading back on the coach to the marina. When we finally got on the boat, that part of the tour lasted 1hr 30mins & they dropped us off at 11.30. For the money we paid, it wasn't worth the tour as the following day, we took a ferry to the Asian side of Istanbul & only paid 1 Euro & did our own thing. Overall it was an okay holiday. It was spoiled due to our stay at the hotel. We did make the most of it though. I would advise anyone travelling to Istanbul to research the city and really plan what you want to do as we were lucky that the rest of our holiday was okay because of that - it was a shame as Istanbul is really a beautiful place! IF YOU'RE THINKING OF STAYING HERE, PLEASE THINK TWICE ABOUT IT!!! Mr & Mrs David

Reviews.Title: “THE HOTEL DOES NOT CATER FOR TEENAGERS :(”
Reviews.Author: harry1Leeds
Reviews.Content: the hotel is not an 3*** or 4**** its does not cater for english breakfast also no pool for teenagers age 13-16 the rooms are not good with damp overall poor hotel :(

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BrianRoss
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 nights leaving on the 3rd December 2008. Taxi from SabihaGorken Airport took one hour twenty minutes at 7 pm, had booked taxi via easyjet which was suberb and cost 62.50 Sterling. On arrival staff met us at entrance and helped with luggage into lobby. Was then ofered various tours ad trips and ways of booking them, all these trips can be negotiated cheaper outside hotel.Was also offered to use there basement health spa for turkish bath and massage again cheaper outside. Room was clean with 2 beds and very comfortable with air con heating etc.Hotel is right next to a smal local mosque so expect to be woken at 05:50 for first call to prayer. Location is superb ie walk up the (VERY) steep hill to trams into sultanhamet and sites of historic interest. Would rate hotel as 3 star and agree with 2 previous reviews and found them very useful.Complimentary breakfast was chese olives boiled egg stewed tea. The fresh bread and jam was very good though.For the money this rates as excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Blaz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a few days at the Assos Hotel. A great location within walking distance of so many attractions. I am writing this review mainly because there are no other reviews for this hotel at present. This is quite a long review so be patient! Now, I am no expert in hotels and my view is that I simply want somewhere clean and safe to stay, without any prententions. The Assos has its faults. During a heavy rain storm water dripped through from the lintel above the window, the cleaning lady placed towels on the window sill to absorb the water. Another guest said she had experienced the same thing - maybe a problem with that side of the hotel? The decor is 70's style. There is air conditioning in the rooms which you can adjust to your needs (warm or cool the room). The bathroom was clean, bath and shower with hot water whenever we needed. There is a computer available for guests to use in the lobby area so can check your e.mails! I found the staff are very helpful without being "in your face." Breakfast is continental buffet style and there is a restaurant though we never used it. The hotel is situated on a steep street within a community - people are busy going about their daily lives right outside the hotel so you get a "warts and all " view of how ordinary people live. It is not picturesque but it is real. The views from the windows are of the surrounding houses, roof tops, car parks, peoples kitchens, living rooms etc. We were able to walk around the neighbourhood without feeling threatened in any way. The Hotel is in such a good location (you could say this about hundreds of hotels in Istanbul I suppose) but this was a real plus. Travel up the road (500 metres, quite a steep hill) at the top you are on one of the main avenues with the tram line that leads to Blue Mosgue/Hagia Sophia, although the walk is much more enjoyable. (Basically you turn right and just keep walking). This road has many banks and a few money changers if funds are short. The Grand Bazaar is also on route on the left (cross by the tram stop and walk straight ahead) as well as other historical sights. Suliymaniye is situated behind the University (top of the hill and across the road). Another must do - once on the main road at the top of the hill, turn right. Walk for about 700 metres. Cross the road and near a mosque on the side of the street there is a sign indicating the former location of the Medressa. This is now a delightful area where you can try a waterpipe. Walk through the gates (tombstones to either side) go straight to the end. Hopefully you will meet Farouk, he will invite you to sit on one of the couches under the hangings and coloured lights (all for sale!) and here you can order tea, coffee, and a water pipe. Sit, relax, smoke. I am a non smoker but have to admit this really was a pleasure. (Ask for the apple tobacco) Now, going down from the hotel, you seem to be entering a poorer neighbourhood. Eventually you come to a dead end - turn left and keep going and you arrive at a square surrounded by restaurants specializing in fish. I found these to be very tourist orientated. Clean, smart, efficient. You'll be accosted with various "special deals" because you are a "special" customer. Personally I was not impressed as the special price offered me had no relation to the price on the bill at the end of the meal. As soon as we sat down, a bottle of water was produced and our glasses were filled (without our asking). This was later on the bill at 9 lira. I guess you need to be aware at tourist restaurants and it seemed to be a slick operation designed to part us from our money. I preferred to find the places where the Turks themselves were eating. Ordinary, yes. Unsophisticated, yes. But real places where the waiters seemed genuinely pleased that you had chosen their place to eat and where the prices were what the locals themselves paid. I would gladly stay here again. I would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a slice of real Istanbul without the frills. It would perhaps not be a good choice for someone with difficulties in walking due to the steep incline of the hill. Assos is not a "fancy" hotel but as I said at the beginning, it met my criteria of somewhere clean and safe to stay and should be perfectly acceptable for someone looking for a mid range hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Assos Hotel Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Mithatpasa Cad. No. 48 PK | BeyazÄ±t, Istanbul 34492, Turkey
